---
If you found the `rhr` package useful for your work we appreciate if you acknowledge the package. We suggest to cite this manual with: 

> Signer, J. and Balkenhol, N. (2015), Reproducible home ranges (rhr): A new, user-friendly R package for analyses of wildlife telemetry data. Wildlife Society Bulletin. doi: 10.1002/wsb.539

For BibTeX users: 

````

@article{Signer2015,
  doi = {10.1002/wsb.539},
  url = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/wsb.539},
  year  = {2015},
  month = {mar},
  publisher = {Wiley-Blackwell},
  pages = {n/a--n/a},
  author = {Johannes Signer and Niko Balkenhol},
  title = { Reproducible home ranges ( rhr ): A new,  user-friendly R package for analyses of wildlife telemetry data },
  journal = {Wildl. Soc. Bull.}
}
````

Please do not cite this manual for publications that are cited in this manual. You should read and refer to the original publications.
